clinical_study.brief_title: Point of Care Echocardiography Versus Chest Radiography for the Assessment of Central Venous Catheter Placement
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study to Compare Point of Care Echocardiography Versus Chest Radiography for the Assessment of Central Venous Catheter Placement in Critical Care Environments

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective study to compare the use of point of care echocardiography versus routine chest radiography for the assessment of central venous catheter placement.

primary_outcome.measure: Adequate placement of the central venous catheter
primary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the period after the intervention to assess correct placement, an expected average of 2 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Time needed for the intervention (bedside echocardiography)
secondary_outcome.description: Time of the procedure will be measured, an expected average of 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Performance of residents as assessed by the time needed to perform the echocardiography
secondary_outcome.description: Time needed to perform the echocardiography will be measured with an expected average of 5 minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Time needed for chest radiography to be performed
secondary_outcome.description: Time will be measured after requesting chest radiography via telephone until chest radiographs are available for review, an expected average of 2 hours
Patients will be followed as per local guidelines to detect complications by central venous catheter placement, usual time Frame of 24 hours (e. g. pneumothorax from cvc placement)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Point of care echocardiography after central venous catheter
arm_group.description: Point of care echocardiography plus chest radiography

intervention.description: Point of echocardiography is performed after routine placement of central venous catheterization and compared with routine chest radiography
intervention.arm_group_label: Point of care echocardiography after central venous catheter

intervention.description: Central venous catheter placement is performed as per local guidelines in critically ill patients
intervention.arm_group_label: Point of care echocardiography after central venous catheter

intervention.description: Routine chest radiography is performed after central venous catheter placement in critically ill patients
intervention.arm_group_label: Point of care echocardiography after central venous catheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who require central venous catheterization in critical care environments (ICU, IMC)
- patients (or legal guardian) who provide written informed consents
- patients aged 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients who are unable/unwilling to give informed consent
